result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. David J Berg

records.addlTxt: Letter from Defendant

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: of the 10/1/15 Plea and Sentencing Hearing held before the Honorable Judge Randy R. Koschnick
with elements and criminal case settlement agreement forms attached

Cases 15CF32 and 15CF104 called together at 9:09am [mo]
Defendant David J Berg in court with Attorney Samantha J. Humes.   ADA Jeffrey Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin.

Constitutional rights reviewed; maximum penalties recited; pleas of "  Guilty " entered on Counts #1 and #2 in the Information for case 15CF32; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; the Court accepts the plea, finds Mr. Berg guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

On Motion of the State, the Court reads in and dismisses: Counts #3, #4, and #8 in Case 15CF32 and Case 15CF104
Sentencing arguments given by Counsel
--ADA Shock submits Victim Impact Statement
--ADA Shock plays surveillance video; start 9:22am-end9:26am(no audio)[marked as State's exh. #1]

On Count #1 in the Information for Case 15CF32
:
The Court sentences Mr. Berg   to 6   years, with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of  2  years &   6 months, and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision of 3  years &  6  months.  This sentence is to be served consecutive to any sentence in being. This sentence is to commence FORTHWITH.

On Count #2 in the Information for Case 15CF32:
The Court sentences  Mr. Berg  to    years, with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of  2  years &  6  months, and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision of 3  years & 6   months. This sentence is to be served concurrent to the sentence in count #1 in Case 15CF32 

The Court finds that the Defendant is NOT  eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program "Boot Camp".
The Court finds that the Defendant is NOT eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.
 

The Court gives  2   days credit for time already served.

The Court orders as conditions of Extended Supervision:
--to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with recommended treatment per Agent
--to undergo any other assessment, treatment or counseling as required by the Agent
--
attempt to obtain/maintain employment and/or education program per Agent
--Maintain absolute sobriety
--no presence in bars or taverns
--not to possess or consume any alcohol or illegal drugs
--subject to monthly testing for illegal drug use
-No Contact with Austin Hanus or Adam Kolp
--to comply with DNA sample provision upon demand
--to pay costs of $268 plus $250 DNA surcharge
--to pay restitution in the amount of $2417.64 to Austin Hanus; joint and several with co-actor Nicholas Schuster
--to pay 10% restitution processing fee
--not to possess any dangerous weapons 


Felony Firearm and Voting-rights prohibitions/warnings given
Explanation of Determinate Sentence form given to the Defendant
recess: 10:07am
NOHs for Def. for Cases 15CF32 and 15CF104 for 10/1/15 Plea/Sent Hrg.
Plea/sentencing hearing at 10-01-2015 09:00 am
Scheduling Notice

Case 15CF104 called at 1:29pm [mo]
Defendant David J Berg in court with Attorney Samantha J. Humes.  ADA Theresa Beck appears for the State of Wisconsin.

Atty. Humes gives status of case, requests Plea/Sentencing before Judge Koschnick. 
Atty. Humes indicates that shall a resolution not be met by this date she will write the Court and then requests it be scheduled at the Court's discretion.
recess: 1:34pm

NEXT: Plea/Sentencing: 10/1/2015 at 9:00am

Cases 15CF32 & 15CF104 called together at 8:50 am [Clerk SH]
[Reserve Judge Robert Mawdsley presiding for BrIV]
Defendant David J Berg in court with Attorney Samantha J. Humes. ADA Jeffrey Martin Shock appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Court examines the Defendant as to rights, understanding & intent.  
Mr. Berg waives his right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds him over for Arraignment.

Atty Humes, no objection
Court reminds Defendant that bond/conditions of bond remain in effect while case is pending

Scheduling notice

Reserve Judge Mawdsley presiding for Branch IV: 
cases #15CF32 and #15CF104 called at 2:17pm.
Defendant David J Berg in court with Attorney Samantha J. Humes.  DA Susan Happ appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney Humes summarizes the limited progress made at Pretrial Conference; there is a need for the parties to view surveillance video and there has been a problem with being able to play the subject video.
The Court and counsel discuss scheduling.  Attorney Humes requests that a Status Conference be scheduled in approximately 60 days, however the Court notes that the cases are at Preliminary Hearing stage and the Court sets the cases for Prelims.
The Court continues the Bond.
recess 2:20pm.

NEXT:  Preliminary Hearing on both cases on 6/12/15 at 8:30am.
Attorney Samantha Humes
Status conference on May 1, 2015 at 02:00 pm.
Pre-trial conference on April 15, 2015 at 09:20 am.
Scheduling Notice

Case called at 1:22 pm [Clerk SH]
[Reserve Judge Sarah O'Brien presiding for Branch IV]
Defendant David J Berg appears in custody, via video, from the Jefferson County Jail with Attorney Yelena Zarwell. ADA Monica J. Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court finds the proceedings are sight and sound sufficient
Atty Zarwell informs the Court that Mr. Berg is eligible for SPD representation

Service of Complaint admitted; reading waived; maximum penalties recited
Preliminary Hearing time limits waived upon agreement of parties 

Court requires a $1000 signature bond, with conditions:
-No possession or consumption of alcohol 
-No presence in bars, taverns or liquor stores 
-No contact with Kim or Lynette Thompson
(*Direct or indirect contact prohibitions include but are not limited to phone calls, letters, emails, texts, social media, other electronic means and no one can contact the person on your behalf except an attorney.) 
-No discussion of the facts of the case with Rachel Black, Matthew Larue or Maureen Stark except through Counsel
Recess: 1:33 pm 

NEXT: (1) DA Pre-trial Conference scheduled for 4/15/15 at 9:20 am - Send notices (2) STC scheduled for at 5/1/15 at 2:00 pm - Send notices
